reviews.review: Perfect sequel to portal 1. This time it actually has a made story to it instead of just doing tests and trying not to die

Dear reader,

This is the sequel to portal, which I also reviewed very positively. This game improves upon that game in all possible ways. Portal 2 is longer than Portal and some of the puzzles are harder so I would recommend playing the first game first. The story will make more sense if you do as well.

Graphics are improved by quite a bit and some bugs from the original are fixed. Source engine is very good.

Linux support for both games is really good, and I was able to play with a good amount of performance using Manjaro Linux even on a very low end laptop (core2duo).

Graphics: 8/10
Gameplay: 10/10
Story: 10/10
Characters:10/10
Cake: lies
Linux Support: 10/10
Optimization: 10/10
File Size: low

Overall, very very good. If you have not played, play it. Typically on sale with the original for less than $10.
Amazing game, good mental exercises as well as fun story. Managed to pass all levels without help (except for one). Co-op mode is a nice addition compared to Portal 1.
Very fun worth the ten dollars

Space. Space. Gonna go to space.

This is the best reviewed game on Steam for a reason. I‚Äôm telling you $10 isn‚Äôt enough for it. 10 years old and it still should be #1 on this list for a reason. This is and will always be my favorite game of all time. The rich storyline, the lovable complex personalities of each character, the fun puzzles, & the killer plot makes it worth every single penny. Valve got just about everything right with this game from the voice actors to the gameplay. This sequel perfectly ties up all the loose ends left by the first game and adds more. I know one day when I return to revisit this I will still have a total blast with this absolute gem of a video game. Even today I‚Äôm telling you get Portal 2, its $10 you won‚Äôt regret spending a single dollar of that. Thank you Valve and all the devs who made this  what it is today.
This is a well constructed game, the only issues I had were that some of the puzzles were too difficult/obtuse that I had to look them up, so that was mildly frustrating.

There are indeed 2 portals

Unless you play multiplayer and there's 4

Game play is fantastic, puzzles are progressively challenging and fun, and the humor is perfect.
Highly recommend!
The multiplayer mode was insanely fun, and portal is always good.  Just wish I could have more of this, since replaying is hardly any fun.  9/10

It's really fun but also very frustrating

Great continuation to an already great game.
Somehow it manages not to become repetitive, with a fun background story and some new technical things.
Single player is very engaging, duets are just awesome. 
 9/10
One of the greatest games ever. Everyone should try this at least once.
Portal 2 is a satisfying puzzler that utilises an iconic mechanic that is implemented smoothly. The story is mysterious and I'd love a 3rd game to continue it.
The best game i have ever played, a classic along with portal 1, I have played this game 5 times because of the greatness.... buy this game! I wish there was a 3rd one

Great storyline in the single player mode, which is much longer than in Portal 1, with new game mechanics and many extra hours. The co-op is brilliant, and forces teamwork with puzzles that must use both portal devices to be solved. Heaps of fun and a really good game to play with a friend.

In single player mode, Glados brings much appreciated sass, and Wheatley is a welcome addition. Overall, highly recommended alongside Portal 1, which can help familiarise you with the game mechanics.
